description: A simple implementation of the PDF-lib library (https://pdf-lib.js.org/) that allows you to merge pdf's in a simple, client-side workflow. No use of external API's or server-side capacity. Open-source and free always.
name: PDF Merger [FREE; no external APIs]
plugin_instructions:
1.) Add the "PDF Document Merger" element anywhere on your page.

2.) In a workflow, use the Element Actions "Merge Two PDFs using a PDF Document Merge" or "Merge All PDFs using a PDF Document Merge" to trigger the merge. You'll need to define the urls of the PDFs and a filename. [Additional actions will come with updates; if you need more options, email me@nicholasrbarrow.com]

3.) Use the workflow action "When PDFDocumentMerger {x}" has finished merging" to schedule a download/save action for your file. 

UPDATES
[2.1.0] (1/2): Direct download is now a native feature -> no longer a need for a third-party plugin; (2/2): ability to generate the merged files WITHOUT saving to database (to reduce file clutter in the File Manager).
